subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* Note that {{w|shinjitai|Japanese shinjitai}} replaces [[鄉]] with [[郷]], dropping the top stroke on [[良]] and instead drawing [[艮]].
* The {{w|Hanja|Korean form}} replaces [[鄉]] with [[鄕]], with [[皀]] in the middle instead of [[良]].
* Due to {{w|Han unification}}, Chinese, Japanese and Korean forms are encoded under the same [[code point]].
* Two unicode {{w|z-variant}}s exist. U+FA69 corresponds to its {{w|Kangxi Dictionary}} form, which is also the [[kyūjitai]] form while U+FACA corresponds to its [[shinjitai]] form.

subSections.title: Han character
subSections.text:
{{Han char|rn=180|rad=音|as=11|asj=10|sn=21|snj=20|four=27601|canj=VLYTA|ids=⿱鄉音(GHTV),⿱郷音(J,U+FACA),⿱鄕音(K)}}
<!-- Chinese and Japanese forms have same stroke count due to 阝 being considered as 3 strokes in Japanese -->
